entry.title: Le Morte d'Arthur: Destiny Calls
entry.summary:
Author: elfinnemrys

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,282Chapters: 10/31Kudos: 12

Summary: Merlin has been wandering for centuries. Waiting for the exact, unknown time that Arthur shall rise again.He becomes a lady of King Henry VIII.He meets Robin Hood and they share a fondness that once reminded him of a certain Prince.He bumps into Matthew Hopkins, the Witchfinder General, more times than he would like, dying a different death each time.But he always comes back.He falls in love and, in turn, becomes a father, a grandfather, and a lonely old man still waiting, waiting, waiting.But this is Matty's story - Merlin's granddaughter. And the ghost of Arthur follows her everywhere.This fic is completed, so don't worry about me not updating it. All in due time :)

entry.title: Swords And Spells
entry.summary:
Author: GhoulSanderson

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,950Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 4

Summary: “How can I ask this of you?” Merlin whispered, “I was meant to bring peace to Albion, not destroy it. I’m no good if you get hurt.”The king took his court sorcerer’s hands. They were trembling, frail things like little fledglings, and he gripped tight and didn’t let go, “Merlin. Camelot fights for what is right. Once magic was reinstated, I pledged to be an ally to you and your kind. I, and this kingdom, would be a disgrace to that promise if I did nothing now.”Merlin gazed at him so desperately. Arthur didn’t know what to do with it. Merlin was always so strong, usually being the one to comfort Arthur. He was his best advisor, and his closest confidant, and he’d never seen him so anguished.***The golden age of Albion was here, or so Merlin thought. After learning of sorcerers in the hundreds being captured and enslaved by a neighbouring kingdom, Merlin felt more useless than ever. What use is Emrys if he can't protect his people? He had to act, but he couldn't bring Camelot into it; the risk was too high. Unfortunately, his friends didn't see eye to eye with him on that, and insisted on fighting with him. Would they come out victorious?Would they survive at all?

entry.title: The Sundered Soul
entry.summary:
Author: DarkWhimsy

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,064Chapters: 2/12Kudos: 76

Summary: When a sparring accident nearly kills Arthur, Merlin reacts without thinking - and exposes his magic before the entire training yard. But the fallout is interrupted by a sorcerer’s attack that rips Merlin’s soul from his body, leaving behind only Emrys: magic incarnate, stripped of warmth and memory. As Camelot reels, Arthur must face not just the politics of magic and the prophecy surrounding him, but his own feelings for the servant who has always stood by his side. Magic has always come at a cost - but Arthur never imagined the price would be Merlin himself.
